review:
awesome and one of the best movie of bhagat singh and other freedom faitor.
best acting by all the artists.

ajay devgn, sushant singh, d. santosh, raj babbar , farida jalal, and other co artists did their acting 100% perfectly.

ajay devgn did his expressions and eye expressions perfectly in all the scene including the emotional scenes.  his expressions perfectly matched all the scene including sarfaroshi ki tamanna song , meeting his father in jail and last meeting with family members.

a r rahman too did the great work. his music suited the scene. he gave best background music and music for songs.

this movie shows the entire life  of bhagat singh very awesomely. there are several emotional scenes. it makes you cry.

the entire ideology of bhagat singh shown here. it also shows the difference between bhagat singhs ideology and gandhian ideology. it shows correctly that gandhi and nehru were chor.

excellent location and suitable spot for shooting.

the singers like udit narayan alka yagnik sonu nigam and sukhwinder singh.

watch the movie for sure and u will love . you will decide that u too will work for your country.

amazing superb movie. it has given us good message that how british use to treat us. they use  to write indians black dogs are not aloud because our skin colour was black that's why they used to write. many indians were angry. they were not supporting these kinds of rubbish . and in last scene was very emotion when those freedom fighters were getting capital punishment.  nice movie. ajay devgans acting was truly good as a bhagat singh. heart touching movie.

what can be a better tribute to one of the greatest human being born in india than this movie. totally justified in each and every department.
best inspiration for india's youth.
one of the greatest film of indian cinema ever.
thanks to rajkumar santoshi, a r rahman, ajay devgn and whole cast and crew to give justice to bhagat singh.

so anemusy watch this movie...

it is often said that movies like this one tell us about the atrocities of the colonial rule. however, to me the movie reminds that india is the legacy of great men like bhagat singh, sukhdev, rajguru, azad and many others. their content, perseverance and vision got lost in past few decades.
